Name: angel
Description: Beautiful, otherworldly beings characterised by their signature halo and feathered wings. Strongly attuned to the struggle between good and evil, they sense the divinity within anything they hold.

Name: satyr
Description: Fey creatures linked by powerful nature spirits to fuel their antics. They are stocky with furry lower bodies, cloven hooves of a goat and curled horns of a ram. Ribald and clever, they cheerfully lead hedonistic escapades of drinking, dancing and fighting.

Name: acid blob
Description: This strange living bubble of corrosive fluids doesn't appear to have any offensive capabilities.

Name: changeling
Description: Shape-shifting deviants, who thrive on their deceptive talents.

Name: demon
Description: Perverse creatures of many aberrations but always with crimson skin and horns. Their mere presence compels others to act out their darkest, most violent desires.

Name: dwarf
Description: Stout, short, and hardy folk. They are known for their stubbornness, metalworking, and love of alcohol.

Name: echo
Description: Astral beings who are a vessel for the indomitable spirit of a vanquished adventurer. Having no motivations of their own, they are glad to permit the possession; for the deceased adventurer, it is a second chance at revenge or redemption. Born from astral matter, they are slightly built, translucent and can move freely through physical obstacles.

Name: elf
Description: Spiritual beings fond of nature and magic. They are physically similar to humans, but often smaller and nimbler.

Name: fairy
Description: Tiny winged spirits, inherently magical and extraordinarily beautiful. When threatened, they can escape through distortions in spatial reality.

Name: giant
Description: An ancient race of towering recluses. Their terrifying size gives them immense strength, supplemented by a voracious diet of meats and minerals.

Name: gnome
Description: Subterranean peoples of diminutive stature, fond of tinkering and magic. Evolved for subsistence living, their metabolism is suited for long adventures where food is scarce.

Name: halfling
Description: Small folk who prefer simple lives. They are notably gregarious, and their build lends them well to less-than-noble endeavours.

Name: human
Description: A medium-sized creature prone to great ambition. Short-lived but ubiquitous; they are not to be underestimated.

Name: kobold
Description: Unfairly characterised as cowardly and weak, these diminutive reptilian creatures overcome their physical limitations by employing vicious and cunning strategies.

Name: lizardman
Description: Large, carnivorous reptilians whose bestial ancestors dominated the world long before the birth of civilisation. They are fearsome predators, capable of leaping impressive distances and warding off many attacks with their thick scaly hides.

Name: mellified man
Description: This mummy confection was created by steeping a human cadaver in honey. Somehow reanimated by an obscure cult of monks, it is both deadly and delicious.

Name: orc
Description: Ugly, brutish creatures with cannibalistic tendencies; this warlike race is known for their impressive strength and intellectual incapabilities.

Name: plasmoid
Description: Amorphous beings who have no typical shape but often take on a translucent humanoid form. While unmistakable for anything other than a plasma-like ooze, this form enables the use of clothing and tools.

Name: brown pudding
Description: The lesser of the two ferrozygotic puddings, the brown pudding is said to taste more akin to rotted milk than a chocolate dessert. The pudding itself feeds upon fabrics and hides of all kind but its most known ability is its unique reproductive method. When brought into contact with iron the miracle of rotten slime binary fission takes place, creating two voracious offspring. Owing to the ubiquity of iron in the arms wielded by adventurers, this creature's population has only been growing with time.

Name: juggernaut
Description: Beware this clockwork machine of war.

Name: tortle
Description: Tortoise-like nomadic survivalists who leave their birthplace, from the moment they can walk, to travel the world with the comfort and protection of home on their backs.

Name: troll
Description: Ravenous, predatory species of monstrous humanoid with a severe hunch that causes the backs of their hands to drag on the ground. Despite the awkward physical appearance, they are powerfully built and are infamous for their ability to rapidly recover from any wound to their rubbery hide.
